帢字的基本解释

帢
qià
古代士人戴的一种丝织的便帽：“裁缣帛以为帢。”

帢字的汉语字典释义

[①]［qià］
［《廣韻》苦洽切，入洽，溪。］
“匼3”的被通假字。亦作“1”。亦作“1”。
便帽。状如弁而缺四角，用缣帛缝制。相传为曹操创制。
[②]［jiá］
同“袷1”。
夹衣。

帢字的康熙字典解释

【寅集中】【巾字部】　帢； 康熙笔画：9； 页码：页331第05
【廣韻】【正韻】苦洽切【集韻】【韻會】乞洽切，?音恰。【埤蒼】帽也。【廣韻】弁缺四隅。【增韻】一曰按頭使下曰帢。【集韻】士服也。【魏志·太祖紀註】漢末公卿多委王服，以幅巾爲雅，是以袁紹之徒雖爲將帥，皆著縑巾。魏太祖擬古皮弁，裁縑帛以爲帢，以色別其貴賤，可謂軍容，非國容也。　【類篇】或作?㡊?。

帢字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体韩国明朝体
帢字的起名意思

暂无。

帢
Basic explanation of words
帢
qià
A silk hat worn by ancient scholars: "Cut silk as silk."
帢
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［qià］
["Guangyun" is bitter, enters, and brooks. ]
"匼3" was passed falsely. Also called "1". Also called "1".
cap. It looks like a bezel but lacks four corners and is sewn with silk. According to legend, it was created by Cao Cao.
[②]［jiá］
Same as "袷1".
Jacket.
帢
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Yin Collection] [Scarf Character Department] 　帢; Kangxi Strokes: 9; Page Number: Page 331 05
[Guang Yun] [Zheng Yun] Hard to Qiaqian [Jiyun] [Rhyme Club] Beg for Qiaqian,? [Picang] Hat also. [Guang Yun] Bian missing four corners. [Zeng Yun] One said, press the head and make the next, said 帢. [Jiyun] Shifu also. [Annotation to Wei Zhi·Taizu Ji] In the late Han Dynasty, the government used the drape for elegance. Although Yuan Shao’s followers were generals, they all wore drapes. Wei Taizu modeled the ancient Pibian, cutting the silk as silk, and Israel distinguished it from its noble and inferior. It can be described as a military capacity, not a national capacity.　【Classification】Or as? 㡊?.
